children.subject: Don't know the answer to the CS189 question, but CS170 is pretty much relevant in everything and more or less a defacto requirement at Cal (i.e. seriously you should take it before you graduate, its only going to help you)
Can someone answer the same question in relation to CS 170?

history.content:
I think it depends on what kind of data scientist you want to be. In a crude analogy, there are "electricians" and "electrical engineers." "Electricians" use tools that others have built and deal with the nitty-gritty application details -- library functions in sklearn and keras, as opposed to novel techniques developed by yourself, are roughly be what this kind of data scientist would be using. In contrast, electrical engineers have a more theoretical understanding of the field that allows them to develop and justify new techniques. CS 189 is an important class, no doubt, that I highly recommend you take. It formalizes a lot of our intuition with probabilistic and optimization perspectives on learning, and it gives rigorous explanations for when to use what technique. Still, if you're leaning more towards the "electrician" part of data science, it may not be necessary to be a perfectly good data scientist. In fact, you'll probably be able to pick up a lot of 189 material as you go through industry.

Also, I'm curious as to the purpose of the question; does there exist some reasonable answer that will make you take 189, or are we here to give you confidence in your choice to take 188 over 189?

children.subject: FYI. Prof. Gonzalez in his advising session said he's planning to teach a class about "Machine Learning for Data Scientist" at Fall 2018. The plan is to be less theoretical than 189 and student can take it immediately after 100. (Maybe w/ Prob 140 as co-req)
OP here! Thanks for for that detailed response! I Don't doubt how helpful it is -- I just think because of my backgrounds so far (100, 160, 186) I am not equipped to take 189.

history.content: Decided to go into data science as a senior after taking CS 100 -- I won't have time to do 189 as I will be doing 188 in my last semester (do not want to double up on these). Just want to get thoughts on how competent of a data scientist I can be without taking an official ML course?
history.subject: Can I be a successful data scientist without cs 189?
